info.title: Elasticsearch Basics
info.description:
This Swagger page runs throught the basic Elasticsearch API end points.It is intended to be used as a teaching mechanism for anybody looking to pick upsome elasticsearch knowledge. The Swagger page runs through a couple of the keycluster management end points as well as all the basic `CRUD` operations.
Sample payloads have been provided for each end point to assist in the learning processing.
##### Every CRUD end point requires that you specify an index name as a path parameter.

get.description:
List indices and their state. This is one of the `cat` end points (Compact and aligned text).
        Which are intended to provide  (CAT) APIsedit
Introductionedit
JSON is great‚Ä¶‚Äã for c

Retrieve Cluster Health 

Ideally your cluster is green (which means no unreplicated shards)
Yellow means you have some unreplicated shards - if you create an index it may by default have mulitple shards.

List of `cat` end points (Compact and aligned text). 

Cat end points are intended for humans to read. Noting the majority have a format query parameter
that lets you review the data as json.

put.description:
Store a document into elasticsearch, the _id for the record will be generated by elasticsearch. 

If the index to store the document does not already exist it will be created 
with the default storage and indexing parameters. The HTTP response code is 201 for this request.

simple_index_creation.description: A **simple** index configuration. In this example we are just setting the number of shards and replicas

complex_index_country.description: A more `complex` document with many fields of different types

delete.description: Delete an index (and all documents contained within the index)

get.description: This end point simply retrieves a document based on the provided **_id**

post.description:
Store a document into elasticsearch while specifying an _id for the record.

If the index to store the document does not already exist it will be created 
with the default storage and indexing parameters. The HTTP response code is 201 for this request.

simple_single_country.description: A **simple** document with only a few fields

complex_single_country.description: A `complex` document with many fields of different types

regionalBlocs.name: South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation

delete.description: Delete an individual document based on the document id

post.description:
Store a document into elasticsearch, the _id for the record will be generated by elasticsearch. 

If the index to store the document does not already exist it will be created 
with the default storage and indexing parameters. The HTTP response code is 201 for this request.

simple_single_country.description: A **simple** document with only a few fields

complex_single_country.description: A `complex` document with many fields of different types

regionalBlocs.name: South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation

post.description:
Store a document into elasticsearch, the _id for the record will be generated by elasticsearch. 

If the index to store the document does not already exist it will be created 
with the default storage and indexing parameters. The HTTP response code is 201 for this request.

simple_countries.description: A `complex` document with many fields of different types

complex_countries.description: A `complex` document with many fields of different types

post.description:
Search for all documents in the specified index. 

A number of example query types have been provided. 

This end point can been used to sample some documents when submitted without a body.

range_query.description: Basically return all country documents with an area of greater than or equal to `1`

post.description: Delete all documents that match a query

range_query.description: Basically return all country documents with an area of greater than or equal to `1`

put.description:
Store a Country Record into OpenSearch and specify _id for the document 

POSTs the document into OpenSearch, the index will be automatically created
with the default storage parameters

update_index_setting.summary: A update to an index setting
